CommonFields.Publication: IEEE Transactions on Dielectrics and Electrical Insulation
CommonFields.Title: Effect of high aspect ratio filler on dielectric properties of polymer composites: a study on barium titanate fibers and graphene platelets
Author: Wang, Zepu
Nelson, J. K.
Miao, Jianjun
Linhardt, R. J.
Schadler, L. S.
Hillborg, H.
Zhao, Su

Mixing.Description: a clear pale yellow precursor was produced by stirring the mixture

Heating.Description: annealed in a oven to remove the residual solvent and most of the PVP
fibers were calcinated at high temperatures (from 600 to 1200 Celsius) to crystallize

Cooling.Description: after calcination, the fibers were then cooled down to room temperature in air

Mixing.Description: direct mixing resulted in long fiber composites (AR = 15)
ratio of Sylgard 184A and 184B was 10:1 by mass

Drying-Evaporation.Description: Prepared samples were dried in an oven prior to dielectric testing

Scanning_Electron_Microscopy.EquipmentUsed: Carl Zeiss Supra scanning electron microscope

Dielectric_and_Impedance_Spectroscopy_An.Equipment: Novocontrol alpha high resolution dielectric impedance analyzer
